title: Buoyant force - change when balloon is submerged

content.question: An inflated spherical balloon is fully submerged just below the surface of a pool. The radius of the balloon is <math alttext="3 lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>r</mi></math> and the buoyant force on the balloon is <math alttext="F sub B comma 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B,1</mtext></msub></math>. The balloon is then pushed further beneath the surface to a point where the water pressure has caused the radius of the balloon to be reduced to <math alttext="2 lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>r</mi></math> and the buoyant force on the balloon is <math alttext="F sub B comma 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B,2</mtext></msub></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="F sub B comma 1, end sub, to F sub B comma 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B,1</mtext></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B,2</mtext></msub></math> ?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
